results.title: The Nargun and the stars
results.brief_description: Based on Patricia Wrightson’s novel “The Nargun and the stars”, this timeless story takes you to the inner heart of aboriginal myths and The Dreaming.

results.title: Nyols
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on Patricia Wrightsons novel of the same name, this is the story of Simon Brent who comes to live with country relatives when his parents are killed. In this episode Simon and his cousins Charlie and Eddie discover the menacing Nyols.

results.title: Patterns in the Air
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
Volume 4 “Patterns in the air” examines the atmosphere that envelops the Earth. This surprisingly thin cocoon supports all life on Earth. The distance between the tops of trees to the fringes of outer space is only a few miles, yet that blanket of water and gases has made Earth unique.

results.title: The Third Planet
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
Volume 1 of “The Miracle Planet” series which examines craters and meteorites and the clues they provide for understanding the origin of the Earth and its atmosphere. It also shows the ways meteorite impacts continue to affect the planet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)

results.title: The Home Planet
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
The home planet is the final volume of “The miracle planet” series and looks at some of the major questions confronting the human race. With our population growing, the supply of our resources dwindling, our atmosphere threatened, and the spectre of malnutrition and starvation haunting more and more of the Earth’s population, what are the prospects for the planet continuing to support human life?

results.title: Riddles of Sand and Ice
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
Volume 5 examines glacial ice, its movement over thousands of years and what we can learn from it. The massive changes that the planet has endured are now being compounded by the effects of humans on the Earth’s surface. The natural cycle of the Earth’s orbit suggests that long-term, the planet is getting colder, yet it is showing signs of warming due to the increased levels of man-made gases in the atmosphere.

results.title: Life from the sea
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
The Earth’s oceans cover two thirds of the planet’s surface and have been crucial in determining the course of the Earth’s development. The creation of the seas was a turning point, the evolutionary crossroads that forever separated the Earth from the other planets in the solar system.

results.title: Something old, something new
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Long-established and recent migrants describe the search for a personal balance between the old traditions and the new ways.

results.title: Are you fair dinkum?
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Looks at national identity and how the Australian way of life has been shaped by migration and the response of migrants to it. Shows the changes that have occurred as a result of the contributions of postwar migrants to Australian culture. Considers the role played by politics, the media and education.
